website_summaries.verdict: Holds the phone in the center of the dash for easy viewing and access. A great choice if you frequently use the GPS on your phone.
pros: Fits and holds tight in most CD slots
Phone can be rotated 360 degrees, giving adjustable viewing angles
cons: May not hold wide phones with a case on
Does not work in all CD slot designs

customer_reviews.title: Very innovative and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent cellphone holder that was so quick and easy to install. I read other people's reviews about being concerned with damaging the CD player, maybe they secured it too much? You have to screw the adjuster just enough so it fits snug, if you leave it too loose then it will wobble around and if you make it too tight then you can obviously damage the CD drive. It was pretty simple and it looks great! I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: stephen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed... not durable.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a few car phone mounts before I found this one, the Mpow 051BB Car Phone Mount. I was so happy when I realized it suited the make of the interior of my car! Unfortunately it only lasted about 3 weeks before it became defective! For this, I am rating it only one star. The wings meant to hold the phone are no longer equal to each other when opened/closed, which causes my phone to not be secure anymore. I will provide a photo/video so that you can see what I am talking about.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Girl

customer_reviews.title: Better than vent mount if you have a CD player
customer_reviews.text: I really like this. I'm not a fan of vent-mount phone holders, because the vents can easily break with the weight of a phone and they also block the vents. You fasten this to your CD player slot and provided that you don't use your CD player (who does, with smartphones/bluetooth/streaming/etc.?), then you have a permanent mount which evenly distributes the weight of the holder and your smartphone over a larger area. I used to use a mount with a flexible gooseneck shaft and a suction cup attached to the windshield, but this holder is a much simpler and smaller implementation which I don't mind leaving attached.
customer_reviews.author: Objective Subjective

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install / Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I just got a iPhone XR, and didn't want to put a case on it. So this works perfectly. The little feet at the bottom give it more stability, but allow for a charging cord without any issues. The arms hold snugly, and release slowly so it doesn't just fall out when you are removing it. The ball joint means I can swivel it to any location, to me or to the passenger if he wants to look where the GPS is sending us. It also means that facial recognition works for it. It's secure in the CD holder, and has an adjustment to tighten it up so it's not going to come out. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Lyn S.

customer_reviews.title: Love that this rotates to any angle
customer_reviews.text: I love this mount for my phone! Pros: Fits in the CD slot, which is the perfect location in my car (Hyundai Elantra) Easily rotates for pretty much any viewing angle Keeps my phone snug, even when I hit bumps The feet help keep the phone in place, but you can move them out of the way if you want Semi-cons: It only works with a case if the case is really slim Getting it to close around my phone wasn't intuitive - you manually move the sides in to fit the phone and use the button to release All in all, I've been really pleased with this product. I've been using it daily for over one month.
customer_reviews.author: D Hall

customer_reviews.title: Holds my Samsung Galaxy S9
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of frustration recently with suction mounts which came unstuck during my driving and almost destroyed my phone. This CD-player mount is easy to install and a great idea as, really, we don't listen to CDs anymore! More importantly, this mount has securely held my phone on several drives both through city and highway driving. Took a little getting used to having the phone screen at a lower eye level than my dashboard mounts but I have adjusted. Simple to take my phone in and out and not difficult to twist the phone while keeping it in a secure position. I have a Samsung Galaxy S9 but really this could fit any normal sized smartphone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Harris

customer_reviews.title: The best smartphone mount I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: I've tried pretty much every variation of smartphone mount (windshield mounted, dashboard mounted, and the air vent mounted). This is my favorite one so far. I drive a 2017 Kia Forte, and installation was a breeze. I'm self employed and most of my day is spent in my car, I am constantly removing and mounting my phone to the holder and it's been more than sturdy. I can't recommend this mount enough.
customer_reviews.author: B Wright

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mount
customer_reviews.text: This mount is super inexpensive, doesn't take up much space, doesn't require magnets that mess with your cards if you have a case that also serves as a wallet, it's durable, it makes use of something that most of us don't even use anymore (CD player) it's overall great. It uses a clip mechanism and a metal screw. Some people have complained about the mount breaking things... The mount doesn't control itself.. If you make it too tight something is bound to break. Just make is slightly snug and it doesn't move regardless of how big the bump is or how deep the pothole or whatever. It won't fall if it is secured properly. It's well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Samazon

customer_reviews.title: Too many detachable parts
customer_reviews.text: **Update** I bought this on October 2017, it broke in January 2018. The side arms became stiff as the weather became colder and they eventually stopped locking closed. The mechanism slowly opens and let go of my phone. I'm reducing my review from 3 to 1 stars. I like that this product has a screw mechanism that secures it to the CD slot. However, it has too many detachable parts so it that vibrates uncontrollably.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: NO WAY
customer_reviews.text: Just tossed the second one of these in the garbage. Same thing happened again. The sides that are suppose to hold the cell so it does not fall just opens up and lets the phone crash to the floor. This phone is just a couple months old. I was upset. I hardly even use it. I wanted it for when I was in the car and using the GPS which is seldom but handy when needed. If I purchase another one it will not be this brand and I may get a dash mount. Or I may just have to lay it on the seat next to me. CAREFUL people I warned ya....
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Great mount. Check for shifter clearance.
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my Volvo XC90. I used the included rubber feet. Nice and snug. My LG V10 and my wife's iPhone 7 plus fits. The only thing I will caution is to check the clarence between the mount in the CD slot and your shifter. Mines cuts it very close but I still like it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R.

customer_reviews.title: Fragile lock/release mechanism
customer_reviews.text: Two months in, the gripping mechanism stopped working. I really wanted to like this thing. This was an exact replacement for one that stopped gripping after a year. The release mechanism is not designed to last. Bad product. 3/3/18 update: vendor contacted me and sent a new holder. It was installed today. Will post periodic updates. My expectation is that holder will work flawlessly for one year. Is that too much to expect? 11/15/2018 update. Arms that hold the phone stopped working. Holder later 8 months of daily use. After opening the arms 1,000 times or so it fails. Poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: NotARobot

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on my car
customer_reviews.text: I looked up the video to learn how to install this item and followed the video, but somehow it started to fall down after a few days. It was uncomfortable for me as well. So I ended up with purchasing the other car phone mount.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Great--for awhile
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little cellphone holder in my car. It is nice not to have to block the air vents like my last holder did. It sticks out a little further than I would prefer, but I am getting used to it. Update 05/31/17--the phone holder is already messed up. I set it on my steering wheel to photograph how it is misaligned now. All the top pieces should be straight in order to fit into the CD slot, then tightened with the screw. I have no idea how hard plastic got so misshaped. Time to purchase something else I guess.
customer_reviews.author: S. Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Received this today. Instructions seem simple enough, followed them. And the parts will not stay connected. Every time i turn to tighten it pops off. Then when i think it’s sturdy enough to hold my cell phone up, which is only an iPhone 8 the thing pops off. Not sure how to keep the two pieces together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: **DOES NOT RETAIN GRIP**
customer_reviews.text: Bought for use in a Jeep's CD slot with an iPhone SE. Considerable torque required in tightening the wingnut to spread the retention mechanism. In time, through normal temperature changes, adhesive grip pads attached to the spread-retention mechanism fall off or otherwise lose their grip. Even with grip-pads, during normal driving the vibration from the road and various road-related hazards cause the wingnut to loosen the spread-retention mechanism to loosen and fail; upon which time the cell phone or other device--along with the MPOW Car Mount will be thrown from the CD slot. **RECOMMEND PURCHASING A WINDOW MOUNT INSTEAD**
customer_reviews.author: Goodkat

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife's car. Works very well when it wants to, unfortunately it rarely wants to. Looks and feels well built but most of the time it won't lock to hold the phone. I would have returned it but my wife didn't tell me about the problems until after the return window closed ***Update*** I received a replacement from the seller. While I appreciate the effort of the seller to make things right, the replacement wasn't the same style and not what I wanted. I was able to switch the failed piece with the new one so I could use the original mount. The new headpiece works much better. Overall customer service prevailed here
customer_reviews.author: Smashing

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Complete garbage at low price point to avoid customer cost of return! The screw is stripped. Rotator ball is too small to fit into the opening of the screw. Even at its smallest setting, we can’t get a secure clamp. It kept falling out of my cd slot, positioning the screen downward. Useless waste of money. Return cost almost equal to price. What a scam. Fakespot reports that over 25% of these reviews are fake.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Fairly Accurate Description and an Ingenious Product!
customer_reviews.text: My car has pretty tight front compartment and using the Cupholder for taller cups and more importantly inserting mu Cupholder Phone holder unit was always a challenge always uncomfortable to use; However, this rather ingenious strategy of transforming the "99.9% unused" Car CD slot for other "IMPORTANT uses" like becoming a Phone Holder is pretty impressive!!. The unit is not bulky but still built strong enough to hold my BIG Pixel XL Phone with its transparent cover intact, and it sits slightly above my gear box for a PERFECT fit as it does NOT block anything while giving me clear unobstructed view to the phone when needed! Great product indeed!
customer_reviews.author: David Oz

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied. But attaching ball joint was much tougher than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Excellent design. Holds the phone securely. Very reasonably priced. Appreciate the the smooth operation of inserting and releasing the phone, plus what appears to be an effective, robust mechanism of attaching to the CD Player I would buy again. Deducted one star for two reasons: 1. Inserting the ball joint into the socket was quite difficult. Perhaps the instructions should emphasize that it takes a very significant force to get the ball into the socket. I was about to give up, but eventually got it to go. 2. I sent an email to Mpow requesting additional information regarding how to affix the ball joint. Disappointingly, I received no response. Luckily I eventually figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: LennyH

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, really cranks onto the phone
customer_reviews.text: Have a large screen Galaxy and it really cranks down well onto the sides holding my phone upright. I do have a ruggedized case on my phone, and it still has plenty of room to release and re-snug. The sides that "squeeze" your phone are foam rubber, very good quality. The release button is easy, and the bottom is hollowed so your charger plugs if it is central like most phone plugs are. I beat down dirt roads alot with my 4runner, and this thing clings to the deck slot with no prob. Been 3 months now, no falls or mishaps.
customer_reviews.author: Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in April and by October it started to malfunction. The release button gets stuck in the release mode, and once that happens it will never grip your phone. I found out the hard way when the phone went flying, twice because I thought the first time I didn't tighten the clamps, and again when I realized the defect. The button needs to be pulled out for the clamps to be able to tighten on the phone. Maybe because it's cold or maybe because it's a piece of junk. Either way, it's useless.
customer_reviews.author: Disgruntled

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation and doesn’t obstruct driving view
customer_reviews.text: Does just as described. Very easy to install into my cars CD player. Haven’t tried playing a cd while it’s installed. Only downfall is it does block a little bit of my screen for the back up camera. Also that same screen is the only place where I have a clock but I just use my phone to see what time it is. I have a Kia Sorento. Overall I’m happy with the placement and the ease of installation and use. I’d recommend this product if you don’t want to mount your phone to your dashboard or windshield. The location is better for me as far not obstructing my view while driving.
customer_reviews.author: N. Boucher

customer_reviews.title: Easy and secure
customer_reviews.text: Received this mount after the previous competitive mount broke. This Mpoe mount is easy to assemble, easy to install and is rigidly mounted and holds the phone secure. Inserting the phone during use is simple using the ratcheting clamps. Simply ouch the button on the side to open the clamps wide enough for your device, set device in the holder and squeeze the clamps tight to you device and you are done. No worries driving and even when you are stopped you can easily interact with your device to adjust settings or apps. Perfect mount and much better that the comparative models and many times much more economical that the competitors.
customer_reviews.author: ClydeP1

customer_reviews.title: Almost a good mount.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Mount started having issues a month later.. have to fiddle with it to clamp down on phone.. barely holds a s20 with ub pro case.. hard to get the right angle depending on where the sun is. Original review below: Finally a decent mount. Tried others and they just didn't cut it. Gave this a shot and I must say I currently like it. The rubber stickers help make it more snug. And i actually prefer it mounted upside down. For the removing phone you need to reach behind. Will update after summer is over. (If memory serves me correct.
customer_reviews.author: AsWangs

customer_reviews.title: Works securely and well
customer_reviews.text: After I upgraded to a larger phone, the extra weight meant it would spin around on the magnetic CD mount I was using. This Mpow mount solves that problem. It fits securely in my car's CD slot, which I don't use anyway, and seems to hold the phone securely with its three-prong support that also keeps the power port accessible. The plastic teeth that ratchets the two sides together and the spring mechanism (?) that releases them seem to be the parts most vulnerable to wear and tear. I would give it 5 stars if it continues to work well, but only more time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: MindKTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: great phone holder
customer_reviews.text: Prior to this phone holder i had a air vent holder which i was not happy with. First of all they would block the AC and also i didn't have a good view on my phone while using the map. I don't like the sticky phone holders since i've seen the adhesive comes off very often in summer, and that's why i decided the get one which mounts on CD player. The installation in pretty easy and it will hold your phone very tight, u would also have a good view on your phone while driving. Over all i am pretty happy with my purchase, 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: jamal

customer_reviews.title: If you've got a CD slot in the right place, this holder can't be beat.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this holder to test how my iPhone mapping apps worked with and without connection to my car's Apple CarPlay. I didn't expect to use it after the app test. Turns out I like it so much, I have kept it installed. Installation is easy. Slide it into the CD slot and tighten a knob. Adjust the position of the holder and tighten another knob. Easy. And it stays in place. It's sturdy and easy to adjust. Just make sure the CD slot is far enough away from the shifter and that the holder will not block your car's infotainment screen.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Benoff

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete instructions regarding the support shelf legs.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up breaking one of the little legs (support shelf) that holds the bottom of the cell phone BECAUSE there was NOTHING in the instructions that tells you to (SWING OUT) the legs (support shelves). When looking at it, the support shelves APPEAR to lower, not swing out. I tried to make one of the support shelf lower down to hold my phone and ended up breaking it. Other than this issue, I would have been very happy with this purchase as it fit my CD player perfectly and would have been a pretty good cell phone holder.
customer_reviews.author: T E Allen

customer_reviews.title: A cost effective way to improve your safety while using a smartphone in your car
customer_reviews.text: If your car doesn't have a built in screen for navigation, entertainment and communications, your smart phone can provide that, but having to hold it in one hand and press buttons is distracting and dangerous. This neat little device fits in the slot to the CD player you probably no longer use and holds your phone steady. Then you can just glance at the screen when needed and pushing a button to skip over a song takes much less concentration. This car phone grabs your phone securely in its phone lined jaws and holds it at exactly the angle that best suits you, then releases it quickly when you're done using it. Good quality and effective.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Lay

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit 2011 Ford Ranger Sport BUT you can hack it to make it work
customer_reviews.text: Didnt fit my 2011 Ford Ranger Sport (Manual) 4X4 ; there is a bezel around the cd slot that prohibits you from turning the key to lock the holder in place. After my initial disappointment, I thought about it and realized I could go find a like bolt down in the garage and probably swap out the key they provided. Using an identical size hex bolt, I was able to swap the key out and save the day. Seems to work, but Mpow should consider a smaller key radius as that doesnt seem to be an uncommon situation. See if yinz can save yours!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: It works but it’s bulky.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, works as advertised. Doesn’t work for every application. In my car, 2016 Subaru Outback, the phone hung down and blocked my view of my infotainment display, loosing the ability to make use of the back up camera. What I did was bought another item and took parts from both to make a solution that works best for me. Car Vent Phone Mount with Expandable Spring-Load Grip, APPS2Car Universal Strong Hold Air Vent Cell Phone Holder for Car  I bought this item, removed the ball mount (from both items) and used the cd slot with the smaller phone clamp to keep my phone up above the infotainment display.
customer_reviews.author: penguins fan

customer_reviews.title: 3 months of use then failed
customer_reviews.text: Update: 3 months after use it no longer works. The mechanism that holds the phone into place no longer locks in so is useless and won’t hold a phone. Highly disappointed! Perfect fit in our 2017 Subaru Outback. Was skeptical that it would work with our large screen in our Outback and using our backup camera everyday BUT this holder is designed to pivot on a ball and can easily push out of the way. Fit snug into the CD player, no issues so far!
customer_reviews.author: Angela M.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and fantastically handy!! I never want to live without this again!!
customer_reviews.text: Recently went on a roadtrip with a gal pal and she had one of these installed in her car. Totally fell in love with it and bought one for myself as soon as I got home. I can't even begin to express how handy this thing is, espcially for navigation while driving. I don't have to look down anymore to find out where I'm supposed to turn, because it's right on level with my dashboard. Very pleased overall! Does block my stereo system a bit, but that's of little consequence and a small sacrifice for the convenience of having my phone in front of me. I never want to live without this again!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Finally writing a review after having the product for over 2.5 years. It still works great. I have done a few things to make it better for me: used sticky tack to hold it in the cd slot and that has not been moved or switched out in well over a year; I have a pop-socket on my phone, so I removed the padding that goes against the back of the phone and scrubbed off the adhesive with baking soda and lemon essential oil; I made "feet" with some Sugru moldable glue to keep the phone from sliding off the bottom on bumpy roads.
customer_reviews.author: J Morris

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP! Release button doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: This item has tons of great reviews, so maybe I got a dud, but mine feels cheap and doesn't work correctly. It doesn't stay stabilized in the CD player, so when I try to look at my phone, it's shaking and makes me dizzy. Worse though is the release button. At first, it was difficult to press in. After two months of use, the button doesn't work at all! I have to pry it open to get my phone out. I wish I didn't waste my money and had just spent a little more on a higher quality product. I would not recommend purchasing this.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Best Mount Ever
customer_reviews.text: So, I’ve hand multiple & many types and styles of phone mounts. They all are unstable in some way. They either don’t stay on the car well, hold the phone well, or you can’t use them with a phone case. Why is there no way to hold your phone to the dash in a stable way without ruining the dash? This is the first mount that is pretty close to flawless. It’s not going anywhere & the phone isn’t going anywhere. Started with 1 in sports car & ordered a second one for my truck. Works really well & worth 2x the price for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Heathen Skum

customer_reviews.title: Great holder for a truck with low cup holders and no vent capable of holding a phone.  2012 F150
customer_reviews.text: This holder installs easily in my Ford. It only blocks a few buttons on my radio but it sits out from the radio surface far enough that you reach around behind if you really need to. Holds the phone in the best position for viewing maps etc. with no distraction from driving. Solidly made. Only slight downside is that it loosens up when it gets very hot. But it re-tightens easily and you're ready to go. Would not be a problem in most climates but have had a little trouble with it in Houston.
customer_reviews.author: andron t morton

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Honda Pilot
customer_reviews.text: I have a Honda Pilot which has rounded air vents in the car, which meant every "normal" phone holder I tried to clip to the vents, would fall off. I needed a different way to mount the phone holder and I did not like the options of suction cups on the dash. I read on a Honda forum about this product and it works great. The phone holder has never fallen out of the CD holder and it is easy to use. It does block the access to the radio a bit, but I have been driving the car so long I either use the steering wheel controls or I can feel my way around. A great product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Phone Holder for CD outlet in car
customer_reviews.text: Have tried 4 different mobile phone holders and this is the first one that really works great for my situatuion. I use GPS a lot and my new auto did not have built in map/GPS. Never use the CD player because you can stream any music you want. Fits great in CD player, holds phone vertical and horizonal and is out of the way of the A/C vent and the stick shifter. Bought another one for my wife's SUV and she loves it. Don't need to remove the protective case from my or her IPhone like you had to with Weather Tech and others that hooked to a/c vents etc. Great price!
customer_reviews.author: Bill and ROSCOE

customer_reviews.title: Skip this please, get suction mounted phone holder
customer_reviews.text: Product never quite worked. Well if you want an item to just sit in the CD slot for decoration then buy. If you want something to also hold a phone skip it. Do not purchase. **update** Seller contacted me after seeing initial 2 star review and quickly moved to resolve issue free of charge. Sent new phone mount that was substantially greater which attaches to the window. I still don’t think CD mount is sturdy enough for a phone and would still skip but the seller definitely has a great window mount with suction cup that seems like it will last much longer. 5 stars for the suction mounted phone holder!
customer_reviews.author: MiCoats

customer_reviews.title: Needs to hands, which when you are driving is very difficult. It also falls out.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made product I am not disputing that. It is that it is difficult to put your phone into and between the prongs that hold it without using your other hand it is not one handed capable. Furthermore, my phone still falls out. I will just keep going down the list. I have also tried the magnetic and that was not atrong enough, my phone isnheavy due to the exterior battery case by mophie
customer_reviews.author: Kymberli S. Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Efficient
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the magnetic mount, the fan clip mount, the fan hook mount, cup holder, hold it in hand while you drive, etc... but this is by far the safest way to mount your phone, both for your health and your car. The mounts that requires adhesive either lost its stickiness and fell off at the most inconvenient times ever or stripped coating off my dashboard. With this I can attach and detach just as easy. I don’t know about you but I haven’t used my CD in a very long time so it’s not a hassle for something like this mount to occupy the insert slot.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Very secure design
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used magnet mounts and my phone will fall off or vent mounts that don’t say attached. This was perfect. And stayed securely in CD slot. I gave 4 stars because I wish the mount were designed to accommodate a pop socket and I had to buy a more flush ring holder which isnt as easy for me to hold on to. But so far this is the best car mount I’ve used for easy of use And secure mounting into the CD holder as well as secure holding of my phone. So overall im pleased and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: jmpr

customer_reviews.title: This works WELL
customer_reviews.text: Nothing else worked for me but this did the trick. The adjustments make it highly stable even on bumpy roads. The grips for the phone never fail and accommodate my phone with the case and the added thickness of a stick on ID pocket on the back of the case. I tried dash mounted versions and all of them just fell right off because of the surface of the dash and the weight of the phone. The easy release makes it super easy and quick to grab the phone repeatedly since I'm in and out of the vehicle repeatedly. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Deveaux

customer_reviews.title: I wish this had worked, but it didn't
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to work. The phone carriage works great, snug, and the release also worked well. The insert for the CD player was stable and since I never use the CD player, I liked that it was blocking the thing. Unfortunately, the ball kept on sliding right out. I tried numerous times to either gently screw it on so that it seemed like it might work and then a few seconds would pass and the carriage would fall right off. Try as I might to get the thing installed, it just did not work and a phone falling around a drivers' feet while driving just wasn't something that I could make work. Maybe mine was a defect?
customer_reviews.author: Milla Pen

customer_reviews.title: My search continues UPDATE 10/2020
customer_reviews.text: Update Oct 2020 this is junk keeps coming out of the cd holder wobbles and I can not return it... back to drawing board Finally found a holder that is sturdy And affordable. I purchased so many different types of phone holders and this one by far is the best for my 2013 Chrysler 300. Yes it covers some ac buttons but I can access ac controls via my touch screen. The day it arrive I had a full day of driving highways and city streets this held strong no wiggling or jiggling with my iPhone X with otter box case fit like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Nacole

customer_reviews.title: Check your dash layout prior to purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Decent product at first glance. Holds my Galaxy S10 well. Soft open when the button is pushed to release the phone. My CD opening is at an angle and it was better served to put the locking nut on the bottom. It does get in the way of my Sync controls somewhat and my climate controls, but, it's better than the phone holder that went in my cupholder. I've only had this a couple days so as far as longevity of construction, not sure yet. I went into the purchase knowing that it could get in the way of some of my other controls, but overall, I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Drillerguy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for the money
customer_reviews.text: The phone mount fits into the CD player slot easily and the adjustment to tighten the mount works very well. The ability to adjust the direction the phone faces is smooth and holds well once set. I'm impressed with the smooth operation of the sides that grip the phone. They ratchet in when squeezed and hold the phone firmly. The button to release the sides works smoothly. We mounted this in a 2002 Mazda Miata. Lets just say not the smoothest ride in the world and yet this mount holds the phone well with little vibration. Excellent product especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: javaqen

customer_reviews.title: Works great... For 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: I give it 3 stars - one star for each month that the product worked properly. It's a great item at the time of purchase. However, unless mine is faulty, the arms that you squeeze together to secure the phone.. stop working. If I sit in my idling car and squeeze the arms together repeatedly about a dozen or so times, it will suddenly function properly. But wtf.. 3 months, MPow?
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Moto G7 Power and 2005 Corolla
customer_reviews.text: Since I have a 2005 Corolla without bluetooth, I opted to get an fm transmitter in combination with a phone mount in order to give myself easy bluetooth. I think the instructions could be improved slightly by telling you that you need to pop the ball socket joint in (first) rather than just screwing it. But that could just be on me for misinterpreting the instructions. However, besides that, the instructions were clear and I was able to install the phone mount easily without issue; it holds my phone in its case quite securely and being able to swivel the mount for either a landscape or portrait display is great. Really happy overall.
customer_reviews.author: Emily M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome invention
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am verrrry pleased with the product. It works and fits exactly as described. No more falling phones, it's Hands free & easily Accessible. Great product for travelers or anyone on the road. Or with kids who want to watch a movie from the back seat or Listen to Audible books 👍😁 It's easily adjustable & flexible. ☆♡☆ I use mine every time I'm in my vehicle. ☆My friends love the versatility of it, so I purchased 2 more for them. ♡Now everyone is safe on the road & hands free. "Happy I am"
customer_reviews.author: Linda-Lu

customer_reviews.title: Almost was good enough, but not quite
customer_reviews.text: This mount didn't quite fit due to the geometry of my console. I got it to stay put for a couple weeks at a time, but it would always eventually fall off. The knob in back is part of the problem, as it's quite large and impossible to tighten sufficiently (for my car). It even damaged the plastic exterior of my CD player (which didn't bother me much, honestly, since my car is pretty old and showing wear and tear everywhere). Nice idea, but has questionable design and is definitely not universal.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Reasoner

customer_reviews.title: Very easy installation!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried MANY car CD phone holders and this one is the best one so far!!! I drive a 2013 Hyundai Azera & there really isn’t anywhere else to put a phone holder because you don’t have the dash space nor much space on the vents! This one DOES NOT BUDGE AT ALL while I drive and I have some pretty messed up roads where I live lol. It’s super sturdy, stable, leaves room to connect a charger & im really glad I purchased :) HIGHLY recommend this one if you’re looking for a CD phone holder!
customer_reviews.author: Cierra

customer_reviews.title: Works for iPhone 7 Plus and Samsung A20
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2016 Nissan Altima and this was hitting gold , I was tired of adhesions and I live in Arizona where those don’t last very long. But THIS, best purchase I made as far as phone holders go. Love the rotation to move my phone in different directions. Fit right into my CD player and the other day I took it out to put a cd in and my CD player definitely still worked. Would recommend to everyone. It did get in the way of my screen but I don’t use the backup camera and preset all my buttons, so I don’t need the screen
customer_reviews.author: Alexia Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Durable and smooth. Although less grippy after awhile?
customer_reviews.text: Started using it on 11/08/2019. Review written on 02/27/2020 After more than 2 months and a half of usage, the smoothness of the phone holder is still pretty good and it still grips pretty well. There are no problems when gripping or releasing. It's still as tight and as smooth as it was when bought almost 3 months ago. Although it seems like it started losing its grip on how it's placed in the CD player of the car. Regardless of how tight you tighten the knob. All-in-all, it's still good as long as you don't keep messing around with it when it's in place.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Salar

customer_reviews.title: WHAT'S NOT TO LIKE!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought four different brands in the past but each was not quite the answer needed. Since I don't used my CD player.....THIS CD PHONE HOLDER WAS THE PERFECT FIT! *Easy to install *Sturdy design *Holds a larger phone!!! As well as smaller phones. *Visually is perfect for driving. *Release button worked great. *Easy to uninstall. Will worth the money so I bought one for my husband's car too. Just makes driving safer!
customer_reviews.author: Pro Nail Tech

customer_reviews.title: Mpow does it again!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly and is exactly what I was looking for. Very sturdy in my CD slot. I commute about 2 hours a day back and forth to my job and needed something to keep my phone in front of me and not dangerously sliding all over my car. This puts it right in front of me, so at a glance I can see who is calling me or what song or podcast I am playing. And it's no more distracting than my radio. I have used it in both of my vehicles and I would easily recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie King

customer_reviews.title: Won't hold my phone up
customer_reviews.text: I'm a delivery driver that relies on their phone for GPS, music, etc. I was happy with this product the first week I had it, but after a few weeks of use the mount won't hold up my phone anymore. What I mean with that is, I place my phone on the mount and secure it, when I try to angle it my direction to look at the map it only stays there for so long until I start driving. I drive for hours every day and if I hit a single bump, the phone mount just flops and my phone is just facing downwards 24/7 UNLESS I readjust it every. single. time.
customer_reviews.author: Naga

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and it actually works!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best type of phone holder I've seen. I've gotten so frustrated with all of the suction ones - they never work consistently! I saw this in a friend's car and got one myself - it works perfectly, we love it! If you have a reverse cam screen under your cd player, be sure to strategically place your phone in the holder or leave it out until you're not reversing your car. Also, if the pad placement instructions are confusing, just imagine which surfaces will be coming in contact with your cd player - those surfaces get the pads.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Di Miceli

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product!! Easy to assemble, and easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This thing was awesome for the first 2 months. Loved every bit of it!!! Held my phone sturdier than any other mount. After having an issue with it, MPOW sent me a new one for free. I couldn't be happier. I pop in my phone and immediately/easily can clamp it down. The phone angle can be changed, is sturdy, and very easy to release. I really can't imagine a better phone mount. Having this lock into the CD slot is the best option for my car. I've tried the ones that plug into the vents, and they're no where near as close as the quality of this one. Thanks MPOW!!
customer_reviews.author: Garo Spenjian

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay in place. Could damage car stereo if not careful.
customer_reviews.text: Installation was simple for my aftermarket Pioneer car stereo, but it did not hold over time. Bumps on the road caused my phone to jostle a little bit over time. The holder eventually became too loose and got close to falling out of my cars CD stereo slot. I was cautious about making it more secure in the CD slot since I was afraid of damaging my car stereo. I think it could work better other types of CD car stereos but mine unfortunately has a CD slot that sticks out too much to allow it to anchor properly.
customer_reviews.author: Sn00py_009

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, I  Through this out and ordered something else
customer_reviews.text: It was very difficult to keep at attach to the windshield or anywhere else. It also kept coming apart, the adhesive but stick to the phone instead of staying in os. It was very inconvenient and barely usable. I had to buy another device from another company in order to have something that held my cell phone safely so I could actually use and view my cell phone safely in the car while driving
customer_reviews.author: Pure Zen

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to install! The tool locks into place in the CD player nicely. I was able to turn the phone holded horizontally and tilt it to look upwards anytime I'm using my backup camera and it was just perfect. No need for adhesive that may get stuck on your dashboard! I haven't checked to see if the CD player still works while using it because I haven't owned a CD in years LOL. But when I find out, I will update!
customer_reviews.author: Keisha

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: I was shopping around for phone mounts for a while and I'm so glad I got this one! It fits snugly into my CD slot and its so easy to slip my phone in and out of it with one hand. I'm really glad I found something that my phone wont randomly fall out of like with magnet mounts or some other styles. I've gotten 4 other people to buy this style - that's how much I like it. Only warning - sometimes when its really hot outside the holder part of the mount starts to droop very slightly. This isn't a big deal at all, all you have to do is tighten the knob in the back.
customer_reviews.author: elainealison

customer_reviews.title: Best one out there!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've had several car mounts. The ones that go on the windshield glass (glue and/or suction cups) tend to fall and it is frustrating. This one goes in the radio CD slot. If you don't listen to CDs in the car, then this is the way to go. It is the perfect spot for it, doesn't take any space from your cup holders. It can be adjusted to any position that you are comfortable with. It fits all phone sizes, you put the phone in, secure it in place and then there is a button to release it when you are done. I bought a second one for another relative as well.
customer_reviews.author: Raven D.

customer_reviews.title: Best ever cell phone holder
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many different car cell phone holders over the years and this one has them all beat. The phone is held securely in a place where it is easily viewed. The CD player function is not interfered with if you choose to get your music that way (for multidisc players- not so much for single disc players). It’s a sturdy well designed cell phone holder. I think it’s an excellent product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Jayessare

customer_reviews.title: This was the answer!
customer_reviews.text: So, I have purchased a few car phone mounts with little success and was getting ready to buy a product that fits in the cupholder for lots of money, but american made when I tried this--this works great!! I still cannot believe it. It fits right into the CD player that I never use, and it is secure and stable. I have had it now for a couple of months and could not live without it--it makes hands free--truly hands free. I can see the phone perfectly--yet it is not distracting in any way. I really like the product thus far!!
customer_reviews.author: lkzzmc

customer_reviews.title: I like it but it blocks backup camera screen
customer_reviews.text: My car's dash is not designed in such a way to leave a lot of options for a mount on the dash so this was a good option for me (especially because I don't listen to CDs in my car). I was able to install it easily and it is easy to use. The only thing I don't love about it is that in the most natural position, it does block the screen for my backup camera but the benefits still outweigh that minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: G. StJohn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have this mounted in my Subaru Forester and at the time of this review it supports my iPhone 8 plus perfectly. The reviews I read where it broke, and having actually gotten the product in my hand, I feel that what is happening is that people are over tightening the CD slot clamp system to break it. It just needs a little tightening, and it is going to bounce around some on really bumpy or rough. It is minimal movement, I can still see the screen clearly with no issues. I highly recommend this CD style holder for your phone, it is well made and great quality.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Works great *** EDIT 12-8-19*** Not so happy now.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Fits phone well. EDIT 12-8-2019... the little button you squeeze to open the arms that hold the phone in place... well, that button sticks now and you have to pull it out so the arms will ratchet closed again. Kind of a PITA. And because the return window is closed I'm SOL. Great idea, but short life for the price. I wouldn't recommend buying for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: senior shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great Use for a CD Deck
customer_reviews.text: Since I never listen to CDs in my truck, I figured the best use would be to hold my phone. It works really well. When you assemble the thing the instructions are odd on where to put the foam tape (which helps the mount grip when tightened, but you don't actually put tape anywhere on your vehicle). It is easy to assemble and disassemble. It holds an iPhone without problem. I use it mostly on longer trips when I'm using Waze. The only real downside is the fact it blocks the radio screen. So if you change channels, you can't really see what's selected. If you're like me and rarely change stations, you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Maintaining to keep it hooked up/ UPDATE!!
customer_reviews.text: I struggled with keeping it in place in the CD player. After a few days it would jiggle loose and completely fall off. It kind of became annoying. When it was first in place and not jiggled it worked great..... UPDATE! The company sent me a brand new one FREE!!! I didn't even ask for that, but it works great. To be honest the first one I received I did not see (or they didn't come with it?) the adhesive to put on the grips that slide in the CD space. With the grips it works much better and totally stays in place. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Lona Jensen

customer_reviews.title: great to see for a second!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this phone holder since I don't use my CD player much (if at all) Sometimes I get the desire to play a CD but then skip it because I don't want to hassle taking the phone holder off. The worse thing about it is that when I have it installed I can no longer see (so have to guess) the button to unlock all the doors of my car. Other than those things I'm really enjoying it. It's easy to put your phone in and take it out It's easy to touch the button to answer or just see the call and keep your hands back on the steering wheel (if you answer the call) again.
customer_reviews.author: Nanette

customer_reviews.title: May not be able to handle lots of usage
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this twice now. First for my husband. His broke within 2 or 3 weeks. The part that holds the phone is stuck in one plac e. He is constantly putting his phone in and taking it out Of the holder. (He delivers items). The second one I ordered was for my daughter. She has owned it for over a month. Uses it before and after work only so less use. She reported it working well so far
customer_reviews.author: AnnaB

customer_reviews.title: Falls out of CD slot of my 2014 Lexus RX-350
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately after using this for a couple of weeks I will have to abandon it as it does not stay in the CD slot. Basically it needs to be reinserted daily because if the mount is moved at all, it no longer in. That said, this fits a phone with an Otterobox type cover, whereas a magnetic mount wouldn't handle a thick case with the little built-in stand An easily accessible button pops the mount open for quick removal of the phone, then you place the phone back in and squeeze the sides to reinstall it. The flange that goes into the CD slot is quite short.
customer_reviews.author: B. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product. Broken Unit Replaced under Warranty.
customer_reviews.text: REACHED OUT TO SELLER UNDER 24 MONTH WARRANTY AND SELLER SENT NEW UNIT. August 2019 Update. Product quality did not stand up to normal use. I went to tighten unit, which had become floppy with IPhone 8plus. The collar nut split while tightening and now the unit is worthless as it can’t be tightened to hold phone in position. Original review. Have an older model car. I never used CD player. This thing fits snug inside and is PERFECT for my needs. Easy to use and manipulate while driving and putting phone in and taking out is a breeze. Well made and sturdy. Follow directions when installing. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MCRinOC

customer_reviews.title: Keeps falling out
customer_reviews.text: The product is okay. The phone sits very well in the holder. The release feature works great with the push of the side button. My only complaint is that the unit would pop out once in a while when you are driving which is super annoying as it is supposed to be pretty tight but nope it seems like the part that goes inside the cd slot is too short and while driving it would slowly rattle out and the entire unit along with your phone would fall out. It might work on some CD slot units but it didn’t on mine. Mine is a Toyota Tundra truck. Will be looking for a different phone holder. Sad 😢.
customer_reviews.author: tvang

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. FALLS OFF AFTER 2 MONTHS.
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was so happy with my purchase. I had researched car mounts extensively. Georgia is a hands-free state. However, after two months, the mount keeps falling off. It is completely useless. I was so disappointed and it was past 30 days so I could not return it. I have purchased other Mpow products, so I expected better quality. Save your money and buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: haute glue gun

customer_reviews.title: Best CD Phone  Holder I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: I must admit that this Car CD Holder is the "best" item I have ever used for my iPhone 6s Plus, bar-none! I can't believe I never thought about using this item. Holds the phone down tight, doesn't move around in the car, and my iPhone is 'exactly' where I needed it to be, 'dead smack in the middle of my console and at the perfect height and reach'. I had a question for the seller, and they responded immediately. How can you go wrong! Go ahead and buy this. I'm sure you will agree with me. Best CD Phone Holder I have ever used!
customer_reviews.author: Jon J

customer_reviews.title: If you live in a hot climate you need this
customer_reviews.text: I've tried different cell phone holders and all the dash mount and windshield mount don't hold in the hot Texas sun. I'm sure the colder climates would have a similar issue. This slides into a CD slot so it doesn't fall. I can see the map as I drive. Cup holder styles you have to look down to see the map. This is perfect for drivers who rely on map apps (Uber Lyft Favor etc) without blocking your vent.
customer_reviews.author: Chatty Biker

customer_reviews.title: Great CD Phone holder!!!
customer_reviews.text: This CD phone holder is very secure in the CD player opening. With this one you can tighten the mounting bracket in the CD opening to secure your phone in the bracket. I had another manufacturer's CD phone holder in the past and I had to wedge a credit card under the mounting bracket to keep it secure in the CD slot. Also, to remove your phone from this mount, there is a single button to press and you can just pick your phone from the mount. I would highly recommend this CD Slot Phone Holder!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Walber

customer_reviews.title: Best mount we've tried so far
customer_reviews.text: I did a ton of research before choosing a phone mount for my car and I'm so glad I went with this product. I wanted something that I could easily use one handed for both placing the phone into the mount and releasing it, quickly and efficiently. Being and to rotate the view and adjust the angle is great too. This thing worked so well I bought a second for my husband. It's a great product, I definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: F63

customer_reviews.title: Not a well-designed product
customer_reviews.text: I am on my 5th phone holder and had high hopes for this one. Unfortunately, it started falling off from the CD slot only after 2 weeks of use. Moreover, it is not easy to install as the part that you are supposed to screw on to keep the holder secured in the CD slot is located too close to the holder's base, making it essentially very difficult to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Ella A.

customer_reviews.title: Love This!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize what I was missing!!! I have a Lexus RX350 and always kept my phone in the door handle. I thought that worked fine but would try this since it got good reviews. It was easy to assemble and fits perfectly in my CD slot. I don't play CD's since I have my iPod connected and listen to satellite radio. It also doesn't block anything I need to see or AC vents. This makes having my phone visible much safer! I can see my maps (Waze), monitor whatever I need at a light quickly and never have to take my eyes off the road. I would highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Safe & Secure
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this product I am a Uber driver and I have bought several phone mounts that have been ineffective an unstable and this one fit perfectly into my CD player I was able to tighten it and it remain stable through all the bumpy roads and hard braking.... The Amazon disclaimer said due to customer reviews this product was not compatible with 2013 Hyundai elantras so I started not to purchase it but I thought I would give it a try anyway it fits my 2013 Hyundai Elantra perfectly it was easy to install it took less than 2 minutes and it's one of the best purchases I've probably ever made for my rideshare business.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Miles

customer_reviews.title: Returned because of defect but Mpow customer service sent me an apology
customer_reviews.text: I got this mount for my girlfriend a some weeks ago. Worked good. Then, a spring in it broke, so I returned it and purchased a different one. To my surprise, i recieved an email from Mpow with apologies for the defect and they sent me, free of charge, a couple of new mounts. Now, its not the type of mount i purchased but still appreciate that Mpow cared enough to send me some complimentary mounts for the trouble. EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SUPPORT
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough, some room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: I have this in the cd slot in my car. It works well enough - I like that it securely holds the phone vertically or horizontally. The actual phone holding part of this is great. The part that slides into the cd player is pretty precarious. Every morning and evening the cd slot part slides out and the holder sort of hangs out of the cd slot until I push it back in. It hasn't fallen out yet, I just have to constantly push it back in. I don't mind pushing it back in, takes 2 seconds, so for now I think it works well enough
customer_reviews.author: Ryan East

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy phone mount!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! I've been through a lot of phone mounts & they ended up not working long & would be unsafe falling, especially at feet while driving after hitting a bump or a rough road, which was so frustrating. This guy is sturdy though, very happy with purchase! It's been a few months so far & use it all the time & still working great. Only con is not sure if you can use your CD player while it's in, haven't tried yet since a little worried about it. But still giving it 5 stars since works great for what it's for. :)
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Buy this now!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried every type of phone mount there is. They all have sucked until now. Easy to install, easy to adjust, easy to take phone in and out of it and super sturdy! I've had it a few months now and not one single problem. I live in the desert and was forever struggling with the adhesives and suction variations losing their effectiveness. This is the perfect design!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I would of given this 5 stars as it holds my IPhone Plus with a large case on it really well... inside the box is a a rage that says scan the QR code and get a two year warranty. Well that was a bit of a headache, it wouldn’t let me copy / paste the long order number, typed it by hand and said it couldn’t find the order and I’m not spending more time on a device that only cost $13.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Holds phone with thick case
customer_reviews.text: I have a Galaxy S5 in a folio case and this mount holds it where I can safely use it while driving. I can quickly and easily remove it. I have a dash cover and Subaru Eye Sight, so dash and windshield mounts aren't an option. It does cover part of my infotainment screen. I like that the legs that support the bottom of the phone fold in when not in use, but they are small pieces of plastic, so I hope they last. I wish that the side brackets were a bit deeper (because of my case), but it holds the phone securely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent idea, but just doesn’t hold.
customer_reviews.text: This cd mounted phone holder didn’t stay in my CD player well enough to hold my phone. About ten minutes in to any drive, it would vibrate right out of the slot and drop my phone onto the hard console. I stopped trying for fear that it would damage my device on impact. Decent idea, but just not functional. Tried in another vehicle with the same results.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Latest purchase lasted less than 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Installed in our 2000 Dodge R/T and 2005 Toyota 4-runner. Had to flip the one for the Dodge upside down because the tightening screw knob didn't have clearance in the top position. Worked fine upside down. Now we just need to see how durable they are. They both seem to fit securely and we are quite happy with the purchase. I will be back to edit if we have problems. ***4/1/19*** The first ones we bought wore out and stopped working. Couldn't tighten them. Ordered a replacement. It didn't even last 2 weeks and it broke.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeful

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit a 2016-17 Mercedes
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a good product... but it is not compatible with all CD slots. My 2016 Mercedes C-class (C450) will not support it without damaging the fascia on the CD component of the dash board. Even the included instructions warn that this MAY damage your CD slot on some models and such. So, this is not a dig on the product... but a caution to be careful when buying and installing it. (I gave mine to my kids and will try again)
customer_reviews.author: J. Toepfer

customer_reviews.title: 100% would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This is a super convenient phone mount that does not require an adhesive that could mess up your dash. It does block some of the buttons from my radio and AC, but the ease of use and knowing I could just take off of the mount if I really wanted to, is awesome. Love the button feature that lets me set my phone Snuggly in place every single time. It feels really sturdy and I have clear and easy access to my phone from the driver seat.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and works great without taking up the cupholders
customer_reviews.text: No more phones sliding and falling down. Bought this mostly for driving trips when our cupholders are used for water and there's nowhere to put two phones without them sliding to the floor at every turn. This frees up the cupholder and is easily accessible. Price can't be beat for a really great product that fits both an Iphone SE and a Galaxy android with a click of a button. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: cathy

customer_reviews.title: Secure, compatible with Toyota 2007 Prius
customer_reviews.text: This adapter fits securely in my 2007 Prius' CD slot. It greatly resists sideways movement, but it wiggles just a bit up and down. You squeeze the sides to grip a phone, then they hold that gripping position. There is a button on the left side that releases the spring-loaded side arms so they release the phone. It's fun to attach and detach my phone to this mount.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea & Nathan

customer_reviews.title: 5 STARS but don't do this...
customer_reviews.text: I believe it's the best of four I've recently purchased (3 went back!). I did have to mount the part into the CD slot in my 2015 Buick Lacrosse with the knob facing down since the rest of the plastic surrounding the area above the CD slot protrudes, which causes the lock knob to touch the plastic dash parts and thus it can't be tightened. Turning it downward solved the problem. It connected snugly to the CD slot and my Samsung Note 8 fit well in the holder and can easily be twisted into landscape position, esp if you're using a map app like Google maps or watching a video while driving (NOT ENCOURAGED!!!).
customer_reviews.author: R Mauro

customer_reviews.title: Not made for Toyota/update
customer_reviews.text: This holder does not work well in Toyota Sieanna, it’s a cd type holder, and I have it in upside down because the knob to tighten does not fit under the lip of the dashboard Mpow sent me a different type of holder, while I appreciate this, I don’t know what it is about my car but this holder didn’t stick to the dash board, so I’m still in search of a holder that will work in my car, I gave the new one to my son, he has a Subaru and he says it’s working fine
customer_reviews.author: A. Smith

product_meta.title: Mpow 051 Car Phone Mount, CD Slot Car Phone Holder, Car Mount with Three-Side Grips and One-Touch Design Compatible iPhone 11/11Pro/11Pro Max/Xs MAX/XR/XS/X/8/8Plus, Galaxy S10/S10+/S10e/S9/S9+/N9/S8
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackWide Compatibility
iPhone: 11 Pro Max / 11 Pro / 11 / Xs / Xs Max / XR / X / 8 Plus / 8 / 7 Plus / 7 / 6s Plus / 6s / 6 Plus / 6 / SE / 5s / 5c / 5/J7/J6/J5/J3;
Galaxy: Note 10/ Note 10+/ S10 / S10+/ Note 9 / S9+ / S9 / Note 8 / Note 5 / S8+ / S8 / S7 / S7 Edge / S6+ / S6 / S5;
Google: Pixel 4 XL/4/ 3 XL / 3/ 2XL/ 2/ XL/ Pixel, Nexus 6P/ Nexus 5x;
LG: G7/ G6/ G6 Plus/ V30/ V30 Plus/ V20;
Xiaomi: Redmi Note 8/ Note8 Pro/ Note 7
One Plus: 7T/ 7T Pro/ 7 Pro/ 7/6T

Warm Prompts
1. Make sure there is a CD slot in your car before purchase.
2. Not suitable for ultra-wide, closed-type, or irregular CD slots.
3. It is recommended to remove the thick/bulky phone stand holder on the back of the phone/case.
4. When inserting or ejecting a CD, you have to remove the CD slot phone holder first.
feature_bullets: CONVENIENT FOR GPS NAVIGATION AND CALL- MPOW car phone mounts are essential to keep car drivers safe on the road by allowing drivers to keep both hands on the wheel and keep an eye on GPS navigation. The cell phone car mounts reduce the likelihood of accidents that can harm you and your passengers.

PHONE COMPATIBILITY-The arms extend from 1. 8in. /4. 5cm to 3. 8in. /10cm. The 0. 6in. (1. 5cm) deep arms work well to hold models from 4. 7’’~6. 8’’, even with a thin case on, including but not limited to the new iPhone 11 Pro Max/11 Pro/11/Xs Max/XR/XS/X/8 Plus/8/7 Plus/7; Galaxy Note10+/Note10/S10/S10e/S10+/S9+/S9/Note 9/Note 8/S8; Pixel/Nexus; LG; OnePlus; Xiaomi; Moto and more.

CD SLOT MOUNTS-Does your car CD player go unused? Make it functional again with MPOW phone holder. The base slips into your CD slot; then, it expands and locks into place, so your phone is always safe and stable. NOTE: Flip over to install for wider compatibility with different cars.

THREE SIDES GRIP DESIGN- MPOW car phone mount has three side grips to hold your device in place. A little button along the sides can be pushed which prompts the phone to pop out of the mount. What’s more, you get a 360-degree rotation for great viewing angles.

FITS 99% OF THE CD SLOTS: The car mount base won’t damage your CD slot, and can have its width customized for a secure fit by turning the knob, making the CD slot mount suitable for most vehicles with a standard CD player. You can still listen to CDs with the mount installed.
